intro: Sphaerostephanos sakayensis, commonly known as the Philippine star orchid, is a rare and endemic orchid species native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and striking, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in montane forests. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to greenish-white, with intricate patterns that aid in pollination by specific insect species. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a threatened species.
